H0.text: (At early 2000s) the only nation in the world with effectively no shortage of donated human organs, due to a free market in their trade is. China

H1.text: (At early 2000s) the only nation in the world with effectively no shortage of donated human organs, due to a free market in their trade is. India

H2.text: (At early 2000s) the only nation in the world with effectively no shortage of donated human organs, due to a free market in their trade is. United States

H3.text: (At early 2000s) the only nation in the world with effectively no shortage of donated human organs, due to a free market in their trade is. IrƒÅn

A4.text: Only around 0.01 percent of people in India donate their organs after death.

A5.text: India performed the second largest number of transplants in the world in 2019 (after United States) but its donation rate was only 0.65 per million population.
